newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE white sugar edges lower, focus on switches.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE white sugar edges lower, focus on switches.

text.p: White sugar futures edged slightly lower in late Wednesday dealings with activity focusing on nearby switches, traders said.
Business was largely routine with major players away attending a week-long industry gathering in London.
Traders said late buying on the dips helped support prices.
By 1535 GMT, December was down $1.10 at $315.80 a tonne, just barely above a major test support at $315.00.
Analysts said a move below $315.00 would see the market falling the next support at $310.
Second-position March was 40 cents off at $313.20.
In spreads, active Dec/March and Dec/May switches were dealt at $2.50 each.
In fundamental news, traders confirmed Libya has bought two cargoes of 45 ICUMSA white sugar for December shipment.

Earlier, there was talk that Libya could have booked up to four cargoes, one for November delivery and three for December. Elsewhere, news Brazil has approved a final tranche of 1.04 million tonnes of tax-free sugar exports from the 5.2 million export limit was within trade expectation and had no impact.
The market also ignored news of damage to the Cuban sugar cane crop following a hurricane after Havana said the island still aimed to improve on last year's 4.45 million tonnes.
Paris sugar were also slightly lower with March easing 20 cents at $313.20.
